page.title: 06SIR WILLIAM PERKINS SCHOOL
page.content: Sir William Perkins founded a school in l725 for 25 boys, in Windsor St., Chertsey. They were taught reading, writing, arithmetic and all about the Church of England. Later he raised enough money to also educate 25 girls. The school moved to its present site in Guildford Road in l882. Early this century it became a fee paying Grammar school for girls but later was maintained by Surrey Education Authority. In l978 the school again became independent and now educates about 440 day girls aged between ll and l9. The school takes part in many sporting events, it stages drama productions and musicals and has its own orchestra. The school is still increasing in size with a recently completed sixth form centre.
